glyphs.contextualNote: Central concept representing both physical light emission and emotional love. Primary glyph for the light-based species, appearing most frequently in transmissions. Forms the core of the E'lorian identity.
Visual perception concept. Rotated 90째 variant of base glyph. Essential for light-based species communication and stellar observation. Represents the ability to perceive across dimensional barriers.
Core auditory concept for the sound-based species. Represents musical expression, vocal communication, and the fundamental nature of Ka'lan existence. The most versatile glyph in the system.

Fundamental structure concept. Base glyph that serves as foundation for pronoun variations through rotation. Represents both physical and abstract formation, and serves as the root for personal pronouns.
Spatial and emotional distance concept. Essential for describing interdimensional separation and the effort to bridge cosmic divides. The base form represents physical extension across space.

Temporal preservation concept. Rotated 270째 variant indicates active recall. Critical for maintaining connection across cosmic cycles and time. Represents the bridge between past and present experience.
Negation and opposition concept. Rotated 270째 variant suggests temporal or conceptual negation. High confidence due to clear logical contexts. Essential for expressing impossibility and contrast.
Cyclical pattern concept. Represents the recurring orbital meetings between the interdimensional lovers. Suggests both temporal and spatial cycles, fundamental to their relationship's structure.

Temporal flow and finitude concept. Represents the passage of time and the recognition of impermanence. Central to the tragic element of the love story, acknowledging that even cosmic love has limits.

Infinite expanse concept. 180째 rotation of the time glyph, suggesting sky as the opposite of finite time - representing eternal space and transcendence. The final destination of their unified consciousness.

Life form designation. Unique glyph representing recognition of other intelligent species. Used in contexts of cosmic communion and universal connection, acknowledging the diversity of conscious beings.
Second person pronoun. Rotated variant of the shape glyph, representing the addressed being in communication.
First person pronoun. Rotated variant of the shape glyph, representing the speaker in communication.
First person plural pronoun. Rotated variant of the shape glyph, representing collective identity.
